page.title: 19LANDSCAPE, Welwyn G.C.
page.content: Looking from above our plot we would see open{farmland, trees, houses, {River Lee, lakes, marshland}and the {A1(M)}which cuts the area in half. {To the west}level farmland is mainly used for annual crops (wheat, barley and potatoes).Farm{buildings}are of concrete, brick and asbestos and blend well with the landscape.Machines can be seen working the land and cattle are in the fields at times.The largest and most common tree is the oak. {To the east}houses and shopping areas are well set out, spacious, and new and old blend well, with red tiles and brickwork. A number of lakes fed by the river provide recreational and ornamental facilities. Marshland in the S.E.corner may soon be a further leisure area. {Wild life}includes Rabbits, Grey Squirrels, Herons and many other birds
